name: shad
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a thin fish that lives in the sea but swims up rivers to produce its eggs, or the flesh of this fish eaten as food: The men come here every year to fish for shad. The shad used to swim up this river every spring. I chose baked shad served over sauteed pak choi with new potatoes.
More examplesFewer examplesPollution has caused a large drop in the number of shad that are being caught.It could take years for the number of shad in the bay to get back to what they used to be.The fishermen here used to catch millions of shad every year.
